result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Alonso Jacobo Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesus Alonso Jacobo Ruiz in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn in Interpreter Enrique Soria.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on the record to amend Count 1 to Resisting or Obstructing an Officer Wis. Stat. 946.41(1).  DE entered a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea Colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepts plea, finds DE guilty.  Court orders court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Court read in and dismisses Ct. 2. ba

by Jesus Alonso Jacobo Ruiz

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without valid prescription.
Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on September 22, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesus Alonso Jacobo Ruiz appears in person, in custody.  Court swears in interpreter.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $5,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is September 22, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
